isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS PT PACER - 1992-1993 - SYSTEM COMPONENTS AND OPERATION - WITH KYSOR ENGINE SHUTDOWN

svcproc.title: WITH KYSOR ENGINE SHUTDOWN
svcproc.para: When starting a Kysor equipped vehicle, for the first 30 seconds the ignition power to the PCU and fuel shutoff solenoid is controlled by the Kysor Control Module. During the 30-second start period, the Kysor Control Module supplies ignition voltage (circuit P19A) to the PCU and the fuel shutoff solenoid from the Kysor relay (93).

After the 30-second start interval, the ignition power source to the PCU and fuel shutoff solenoid is controlled by the Alarmstat and the Pressurestat. Circuit 19J/19D from the alarmstat supplies the voltage to the fuel shutoff solenoid and PCU after the 30-second delay period has ended and sufficient oil pressure is available to close the NO contact in the pressurestat.

In the event of low oil pressure (less than 5 PSI) or high engine coolant temperatures (higher than 225 degrees F), the power to the fuel shutoff solenoid and the PCU is cut off, which will shut down the engine to prevent engine damage.
